intro: Fagara crassifolia, commonly known as the rough-leaved fagara, is a species of flowering plant in the family Anacardiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in moist, shaded forest understories. The plant is characterized by its thick, leathery leaves with a rough texture and its small, clustered yellowish-green flowers. Fagara crassifolia produces small, red berries that are an important food source for various bird species. Its botanical features make it a notable component of its native ecosystems.
